intro: Didymocheton carrii, commonly known as the Carri's bottle tree, is a member of the Malvaceae family and is native to northern Australia. It is characterized by its distinctive swollen stem, which stores water, and its bottle-shaped trunk. The plant has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in spikes. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy soils. Didymocheton carrii is a slow-growing shrub that plays a role in stabilizing soils in its native habitat.
